headline: Could Supply Chain Strains at Wentzville Reveal Deeper Resilience Challenges for GM (GM)?
summary: General Motors recently paused operations at its Wentzville Assembly plant in Missouri for three weeks, implementing temporary layoffs for most workers as a result of ongoing supply chain and parts shortages. This shutdown highlights the persistent vulnerability of GM’s manufacturing network to external disruptions, with production of mid-size pickup trucks and full-size vans directly affected. We will explore how the recent production halt at Wentzville may influence General Motors’...
